statements: SELECT * FROM employees
SELECT first_name, last_name, phone_number FROM employees
SELECT last_name, first_name FROM employees ORDER BY last_name DESC
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE address LIKE 'New York%'
SELECT first_name, last_name, phone_number FROM employees WHERE phone_number LIKE '%555%'
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE employee_id = 1;
SELECT first_name, last_name, phone_number FROM employees WHERE employee_id > 100 ORDER BY last_name ASC;
SELECT employee_id, first_name, address FROM employees WHERE last_name LIKE 'D%' ORDER BY employee_id DESC;
SELECT last_name, address FROM employees WHERE phone_number IS NOT NULL AND address IS NOT NULL ORDER BY last_name, address;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE first_name IN ('John', 'Maria', 'Alex') AND address LIKE '%Street%' ORDER BY employee_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, address FROM employees WHERE employee_id = 1;
SELECT contact_number, name FROM employees WHERE address LIKE 'New%';
SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT department_name FROM departments WHERE department_id = 10;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE address LIKE '%Street%' ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT employee_id, name, address FROM employees WHERE employee_id > 100 ORDER BY employee_id ASC;
SELECT name, contact_number FROM employees WHERE name LIKE 'A%' AND contact_number IS NOT NULL;
SELECT employee_id, name, address, department_name FROM employees JOIN departments ON employees.employee_id = departments.department_id WHERE department_name = 'HR';
SELECT employee_id, name, contact_number FROM employees WHERE employee_id IN (1, 5, 10);
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM employees;
SELECT address FROM employees;
SELECT * FROM addresses WHERE city='New York';
SELECT phone_number, email FROM contact_details;
SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY employee_id DESC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, address FROM employees WHERE first_name LIKE 'A%' ORDER BY last_name;
SELECT employees.first_name, addresses.street_address, addresses.city, addresses.state FROM employees JOIN addresses ON employees.employee_id = addresses.employee_id;
SELECT employees.first_name, contact_details.phone_number FROM employees JOIN contact_details ON employees.employee_id = contact_details.employee_id WHERE contact_details.email LIKE '%gmail.com';

SELECT employees.first_name, addresses.city, contact_details.email FROM employees JOIN addresses ON employees.employee_id = addresses.employee_id JOIN contact_details ON employees.employee_id = contact_details.employee_id WHERE addresses.state = 'CA';
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name FROM employees ORDER BY last_name DESC;
SELECT department_id, department_name FROM departments;
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name, address, contact_number FROM employees WHERE address LIKE 'Main%' ORDER BY employee_id ASC;
SELECT employee_id, SUM(salary) AS total_salary FROM salaries GROUP BY employee_id HAVING total_salary > 50000;
SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY employee_id DESC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, address FROM employees WHERE first_name = 'Alice';
SELECT department_name, COUNT(*) FROM employees JOIN departments ON employees.employee_id = departments.department_id GROUP BY department_name;
SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name, s.salary FROM employees e JOIN salaries s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id WHERE s.salary > 50000;
SELECT c.email, e.first_name, e.last_name, d.department_name FROM contacts c JOIN employees e ON c.employee_id = e.employee_id JOIN departments d ON e.employee_id = d.department_id;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employees WHERE id = 1;
SELECT department_name FROM departments ORDER BY department_id DESC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, address FROM employees WHERE id BETWEEN 2 AND 5;
SELECT * FROM contacts WHERE employee_id = 3 ORDER BY contact_type ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT first_name, last_name, address FROM employees WHERE id = 1;

SELECT department_name, COUNT(employee_id) AS total_employees FROM departments LEFT JOIN employees_departments ON departments.department_id = employees_departments.department_id GROUP BY department_name;
SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name, s.salary FROM employees e JOIN salaries s ON e.id = s.employee_id WHERE s.salary > 50000 ORDER BY s.salary DESC;
SELECT c.contact_type, c.contact_info, CONCAT(e.first_name, ' ', e.last_name) AS full_name FROM contacts c JOIN employees e ON c.employee_id = e.id WHERE c.contact_type = 'email';
